page.title: 14FORESTRY IN WARDOUR
page.content: The{woodland}in{Wardour}was planted on parkland.We saw several{Acacia trees which came from{Africa}and a huge {Copper Beech} tree. When{foresters start to plant the trees they have to do so in{straight}lines so that when weeds grow over them they still know where the trees are. The worst{pests are{Squirrel and deer}so they have a special{watch tower}at the top of a tree from which they shoot the{deer. The{main coniferous trees}they plant are{Douglas fir}for{fencing}and{house {building}and{Christmas trees}which are {4}year old{Norwegian Spruce. Deciduous trees are planted to replace ones {felled.}There must be at least two people in case of{accidents.}Once there was a{forest fire}in{1976}and it destroyed about{2.5 acres. _ {Catherine Laura N Elly.
